it can be done as a daytrip from either, or as a stopover in between.
Bus by Casada company runs regular service from Málaga. Takes about 55 minutes. Also AVE train which takes 20 minutes but Antequera station is slightly out of town

Small enough to do by foot but there are taxis.

If you are heading to attractions outside of the town, it would be a good idea to rent a car:

value: price=Entry & audioguide to castle and church: 6e
content=The castle area is worth of visiting because of the beautiful viewing to the town.
directions=Park is situated 16 km from Antequera to south-west.
content=Wulf Park can be visited only during guided tours, which are hold few times a day. There is also café and english speaking staff.
directions=Located 15 km from Antequera to south.
content=Nature park full of rock formated of overslapping flat limestones. There is marked trails. On parking place is also a visiting central with toilets, restaurant and small museum.
content=Clothes shops, restaurants and supermarket. Maybe the only shopping mall in Antequera.

Recently refurbished. Good midday Menu del Día.
Reopened in 2008. Stylish decor nice terrace with pool and stunning views of plain and the Mountains of Málaga.

value: content=Basic budget hotel. The room includes air-conditioner, small fridge and bathroom. (parking 7e / day)
name=Laguna de la Fuente de Piedra
content=This lake is 23 km northwest of Antequera, next to the town of Fuente de Piedra. It's known for its birds, including flamingos.
content=The Berrocal Museum-System is a 3 place exhibition venue around the work of the sculptor

that is located in the Andalusian village of Villanueva de Algaidas, few kilometrs from Antequera. The project offers the possibility to know better the work of one of the most surprising artist of our time, by visiting it’s 3 exhibit spaces:

The Museum has its first wing dedicated to painting and graphical works, that is scheduled for opening in the spring of 2013.

The Studio-Workshop is where you will be able to discover the complex creative and technical process for the production of his disassemblable works.

The House-Museum allows to better know the polyhedric personality of Berrocal and see some of the most important art of the ‘900 through the works of his artist friends.
